title: How to Make a Quiver for Arrows

steps.title: Find some sort of fabric for your quiver, such as a piece of leather, an old shirt, or even an old blanket.
steps.content: Find some sort of fabric for your quiver, such as a piece of leather, an old shirt, or even an old blanket.

steps.title: Flatten out your fabric and fold it at the bottom and up the sides, leaving only the top part open.
steps.content: Flatten out your fabric and fold it at the bottom and up the sides, leaving only the top part open.

steps.title: Sew the two sides together and the bottom separate so that your arrows will not fall out.
steps.content: Sew the two sides together and the bottom separate so that your arrows will not fall out.

steps.title: Get some sort of string to use with the quiver (one really long string or two different, shorter strings).
steps.content: Get some sort of string to use with the quiver (one really long string or two different, shorter strings).

steps.title: Put a slit into the quiver in the middle and the bottom (the slit in the bottom is optional; it is just so the quiver will not slide on your shoulder).
steps.content: Put a slit into the quiver in the middle and the bottom (the slit in the bottom is optional; it is just so the quiver will not slide on your shoulder). Pull the string through the middle slit first and then the bottom; make sure the two ends are on different parts of the quiver (if this doesn't make sense now, don't worry; it will later on).

steps.title: Put it on your back (on your right shoulder if you are right-handed and vice versa).
steps.content: Put it on your back (on your right shoulder if you are right-handed and vice versa). At this point you should have one string dangling behind you and the other one with each end of the string in each hand. You should have the ends positioned at your diaphragm.

steps.title: Tie the two ends together like you would tie your shoes, then take the other string and tie those ends together around your waist.
steps.content: Tie the two ends together like you would tie your shoes, then take the other string and tie those ends together around your waist.
